operations.target_text: Guest Network Access: Visitors to the Company can access guest networks by registering with the office personnel, bypassing the need for a formal access request.
operations.comment: You indicated that you do not have an office, so this section about guest network access is not applicable.\n\nNo office = no guest network needed; Having office = visitors need controlled network access for security.

operations.target_text: Password management systems should be user-friendly
operations.replacement: Password management systems, specifically 1Password, should be user-friendly
operations.comment: You indicated you use 1Password for password management, so we've updated the policy to reference your specific tool.\n\nNo password tool = section removed; Using specific tool = policy references actual system rather than generic language.

operations.target_text: All requests will be sent by email to <email>
operations.replacement: All requests will be managed through Clickup ticketing system
operations.comment: You indicated that you use Clickup for ticket management and prefer using a ticketing system for access requests.\n\nEmail = simple but no tracking; Ticketing system = proper audit trails; Chat = fast but informal; Manager approval = personal but creates bottlenecks.

You selected Quarterly which matches the current quarterly basis.\n\nWe recommend quarterly reviews for most companies. If you operate in highly critical industries with complex or large company structure (1000+ employees), you might consider monthly reviews. Small companies and startups can get away with annual reviews. Pick any frequency that works for your company. Auditors only care that you consistently follow whatever schedule you document here.

You selected 24 business hours which matches the current placeholder. As a company with 24 employees, this timeframe is appropriate for your size.\n\nWe recommend 24 business hours for most companies. Consider shorter timelines if customers request it. Longer than 1 week looks suspicious to auditors. You only get a non-conformity for not meeting your documented timeframe, not for choosing the wrong timeframe.
